verbose_text: Activation of cAMP signalling increases the membrane potential in wild type but not CFTR -/- murine organoids [XREF_BIBR], upon treatment with forskolin, apical fluid secretion is observed, leading to intestinal cell shrinkage and organoid expansion allowing for a useful model to monitor intestinal CFTR related fluid secretion [XREF_BIBR, XREF_BIBR], which has enabled the development of a pre-clinical screening assay to assess how patients respond to expensive cystic fibrosis drugs [XREF_BIBR].
evidence: cAMP signalling increases the membrane potential in wild type but not CFTR
